children.value: Trusting Social (TS) is a data science company that develops predictive models using proprietary machine learning techniques and artificial intelligence algorithms. Our core products are the Lead Generation and Credit Insight Services which provide our clients - regulated lenders and financial institutions - with real-time intelligence on mobile subscribers’ borrowing needs and creditworthiness. We do this by analysing mobile usage data from Mobile Network Operators (MNOs). Through our services, our clients are able to offer financial services to individuals with no bank accounts or very little financial history.

properties.ariaLabel: about the credit insight service permalink

children.value: Our Credit Insight Service provides lenders with information such as the probability of default on a loan or fraud propensity of a mobile subscriber. We deliver this Credit Insight to lenders via our API server, making it an automated, easily deployed and highly scalable service.

Our Credit Insight request and return process upholds data privacy by ensuring that borrowers’ give their consent for sharing their TS Credit Insights with the lender before we release the information.
We employ three service types for lenders to seek consent from borrowers:

We require all Credit Insights to be encrypted during transmission. The details for encryption are provided in this section. We also provide the option to encrypt the MSISDN if it is necessary due to regulatory or organisational requirements.
: You provide us your RSA public key (YOUR
PUBLIC_KEY) when you first register an account with us.

openssl genrsa -out private.key.rsa 2048
openssl rsa -in private.key.rsa -pubout
: We will encrypt the Credit Insight before sending it to you using the following formula.
In this formula, first the credit score is encrypted using RSA with optimal asymmetric encryption padding scheme (OAEP). Then, the result will be encoded using base64.
: You can decrypt the Credit Insight using the following formula.
It is actually the reverse process of step 2, where we first decode base64, then decrypt the result using RSA with OAEP scheme.

We use HMAC authentication which has been widely used by Amazon and Google to grant
access to many of their APIs.
API access key is a pair:
Access key ID: a unique identifier (UUID) of the API access key.
Access key secret: a secret key that will be used to sign the requests.
TrustVision team will create access key ID and access key secret for each customers before integration.
The client must generate a signature for each request, and send it in the

header. Following is pseudo code that illustrates the
construction of the
AccessKeyID and AccessKeySecret: are the access key provided by Trust Vision.
URI: is the relative route path of the resource (exclude the domain).

Timestamp: the time of the request in RFC3339 format. The client must also
send this timestamp with the request in the
To verify the signature, the server first takes the request timestamp from

header, compares it with current timestamp of the server.
If the difference between 2 timestamps is more than 15 minutes, it will
reject the request and return

error to the client.
The intention of this restriction is to limit the possibility that
intercepted requests could be replayed by an adversary.
If the timestamp is within the limit, the server will then parse value from

After that, the server uses the request timestamp to generate the string to
sign, and use the

to creates the signature with the same
method as described before.

Finally, the request is authorized if the generated signature matches the
request signature.

properties.ariaLabel: flow 1 compare faces between images permalink
flow 2 verify face liveness in images permalink

children.value: Flow 2: Verify face liveness in images

Note that we're going towards no-gesture liveness verification, however we can
also support gesture based liveness verification, so in this flow, we allow
clients to send at most 3 images with optional gestures (more than 3 can create
bad user experience, we're aiming for using only 1).

properties.alt: Flow 2: Verify face liveness in images

children.value: the image file to be uploaded
any key-value metadata to save with the image, both key and value should be string
Image label should be one of following values:
the front side of India Aadhaar card

the front side of Vietnam national ID new version (Chứng minh nhân dân mới)
the back side of Vietnam national ID new version (Chứng minh nhân dân mới)
the front side of Vietnam national ID latest version (Căn cước công dân)
the back side of Vietnam national ID latest version (Căn cước công dân)
the front side of Vietnam passport
